perturbation.original_text: DISTRIBUTOR AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is made as of the 1st day of January, 1996 by and between Peregrine/Bridge Transfer Corporation, a Delaware corporation (the "Licensor"), and Neon Systems, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the "Licensee").
perturbation.changed_text: DISTRIBUTOR AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is made as of the 1st day of January, 1996 by and between Peregrine/Bridge Transfer Corporation, a Delaware corporation (the "Licensor"), and Neon Systems, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the "Vendor").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensee' to 'Vendor' creates confusion about the parties. The agreement is initially made between the 'Licensor' and the 'Licensee', but later sections might imply the 'Vendor' has different obligations, leading to uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall pay to Licensor for each Licensed Product licensed to a Redistributor or a Customer a licensee fee equal to 50% of all revenues received (without deduction for value added tax, if any, but excluding any revenues for maintenance and support or upgrade services, which revenues are covered in paragraph (b) below) by Licensee under the Redistributor Agreement or Sublicense applicable to such Licensed Product.
perturbation.changed_text: The Vendor shall pay to Licensor for each Licensed Product licensed to a Redistributor or a Customer a licensee fee equal to 25% of all revenues received (without deduction for value added tax, if any, but excluding any revenues for maintenance and support or upgrade services, which revenues are covered in paragraph (b) below) by Licensee under the Redistributor Agreement or Sublicense applicable to such Licensed Product.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the 'Licensee' is expected to pay 50% but the 'Vendor' is only contracted to pay 25%. This creates contradictory financial obligations. It also makes the mention of Licensee at the end ambiguous because it is unclear whether they are the same entity or not.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee represents and warrants that it has sufficient facilities, resources and personnel to adequately perform its obligations under this Agreement and that no existing arrangement, contractual or otherwise, will cause Licensee to breach the terms of this Agreement or prevent Licensee from fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Distributor represents and warrants that it has sufficient facilities, resources and personnel to adequately perform its obligations under this Agreement and that no existing arrangement, contractual or otherwise, will cause Licensee to breach the terms of this Agreement or prevent Licensee from fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Using 'Distributor' introduces further ambiguity. Although a 'Distributor Agreement', this section suddenly uses 'Distributor', which is then immediately followed by 'Licensee' and creates an additional layer of uncertainty about who is responsible for performing the obligations. It is unclear whether the Licensee and the Distributor are the same entity.
